subject: Fashion
title: Gender Expression Through Fashion
description: A 60-second lesson on Gender Expression Through Fashion.

hook.text: High heels were designed for men. Louis XIV wore them to look taller and more powerful.

buildup.text: Pink was a 'strong, masculine' color until the 1940s. Blue was considered delicate and feminine.

discovery.text: Fashion's gender rules are invented, not natural. They shift completely across eras and cultures.

twist.text: Gender-fluid fashion is growing, yet many people still face ridicule for crossing clothing norms.

climax.text: Clothing doesn't have a gender. Society insists on assigning oneâ€”and policing anyone who disagrees.

punchline.text: Heels were for kings. Fashion gender rules are fiction.

quiz.question: What does the history of high heels and the color pink reveal about fashion?
options: Fashion gender norms are culturally invented and have changed dramatically over time
Men's fashion has always been more practical while women's has been decorative
Gender-specific clothing has been consistent across all cultures and eras
